input_text:
Job Title: Logistics Team Member - Warehouse

Location: Richmond, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Who We’re Hiring: Vortex Metal Manufacturing is seeking a Warehouse Technician to join our team! The ideal candidate will be very organized and highly motivated and able to balance multiple tasks daily. The Warehouse Associate will assist the warehouse team with making sure that all jobs scheduled for the next day have all materials and equipment pulled and staged for our installers. The Warehouse Associate will list return material when necessary and return materials to stock, as well as maintain the shop and yard in a clean and orderly fashion. 
Who We Are: Join the excitement at Vortex Metal Manufacturing, the ultimate destination for sheet metal manufacturing experts in Richmond, VA! Since 2012, we’ve been the unrivaled choice for top-notch spiral duct in Central Virginia, setting the industry standard. With our team’s extensive experience and state-of-the-art machinery, we can craft spiral ducts to perfectly suit any project. But that’s not all – we’ve expanded our reach with distributors across the east coast to ensure your orders are fulfilled with lightning speed and unmatched efficiency. If you’re ready to be part of a team that’s revolutionizing the industry and setting the bar for excellence, seize the opportunity and join Vortex Metal Manufacturing for an exciting and dynamic journey!
What We Offer:Vortex Metal Manufacturing offers a wide range of employee benefits, including:A welcoming, family-oriented work environment that supports work/life balance.401K plan with Roth and Traditional options, including a 25% company match on up to 6% of your income.Medical insurance with three plan choices, including Health Savings Account options.Dental insurance with two plan choices.Vision insurance coverage.Flexible spending account.Tuition reimbursement.Access to apprenticeship training programs.Discounts on Woodfin services for employees.Scholarship opportunities for you and your family.Paths for cross-training and career advancement.Paid vacation that accrues from day one.Employee Assistance Program for support when needed.
What You’ll Do: Loads and unloads material within a warehouse or storage facility. Utilizes hand trucks, forklifts, hoists, conveyors, or other handling equipment to move material to and from trucks and within the storage facility. Records flow information of materials and products. Assists with overall warehouse operations, planning, and daily activities, and inventory management. Supports the planning of efficient layouts, workflows, and utilization of warehouse space. Monitors the safety and security of goods and materials. Utilizes an inventory management system through Monday.com, a propriety production database, and/or other computer software to track, analyze, and report processes and performance.Maintains a clean and organized area. Performs other tasks as needed.
What You’ll Bring:High school diploma or equivalent is required.Previous warehouse, inventory, or parts experience is beneficial, but not required.Previous experience in plumbing, electrical, HVAC, or similar trades/businesses is beneficial, but not required.OSHA Forklift Operator Certification is required.Organized, detail-oriented, and able to operate with a sense of urgency.Multitasking and capable of working in a fast-paced work environment.A team player, personable, customer-oriented, and possess strong written and verbal communication skills.Safety and customer service focused.Strong computer and technology skills as well as proficiency in Microsoft Office and Google Calendar.Upbeat personality with a warm and friendly demeanor.Fluent English-speaking and writing skills.Must be able to crawl, kneel, squat, and climb. Must be able to work in an unconditioned warehouse.Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds regularly, unassisted. Must be able to stand and walk for extended periods. 
Not everyone may fulfill all the requirements listed here. If you possess the necessary skills but are unsure about your background, please don’t hesitate to apply. We welcome your application and are eager to explore the opportunity with you. We’re constantly seeking individuals who can contribute to our company’s growth and success.
At Vortex Metal Manufacturing, we’re dedicated to creating a respectful and inclusive workplace. We’re an Equal Opportunity Employer and don’t discriminate based on various factors, including race, religion, gender, age, or disability. Our employment decisions are solely based on merit, competence, performance, and business requirements, ensuring fairness and equal opportunities for all.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Logistics Team Member - Warehouse
output_json.summary: Vortex Metal Manufacturing seeks a Warehouse Technician to join their team.
job_responsibilities: Loads and unloads material within a warehouse or storage facility
Uses hand trucks, forklifts, hoists, conveyors, or other handling equipment
Records flow information of materials and products
Assists with overall warehouse operations, planning, and daily activities
Monitors safety and security of goods and materials
output_json.physical_requirements: Must be able to crawl, kneel, squat, and climb. Must be able to work in an unconditioned warehouse. Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds regularly, unassisted. Must be able to stand and walk for extended periods.
benefits: 401K plan with Roth and Traditional options
medical insurance with three plan choices
dental insurance with two plan choices

paid vacation that accrues from day one
output_json.company_information: Vortex Metal Manufacturing is a sheet metal manufacturing expert in Richmond, VA, specializing in spiral ducts. They offer a wide range of employee benefits including medical, dental, vision insurance, flexible spending accounts, tuition reimbursement, and more.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: Vortex Metal Manufacturing is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate based on race, religion, gender, age, or disability. Employment decisions are based solely on merit, competence, performance, and business requirements.
